article.text: Free United bloc MP Emile Rahmeh said on Sunday that the Lebanese army did not commit assassinations. “The army does not assassinated. It protects the country,” Rahmeh told OTV following the murder of Sheikh Ahmad Abdel Wahed and his bodyguard, who according to a security official were killed by army members. Rahmeh also said that the investigation commission formed by the army was “carrying out its duties,” and called on Akkar residents to stand by the army. He added that it was “unacceptable to target” the Lebanese army, which was the “institution” that protected all Lebanese people. According to AFP, a security official said army troops shot dead Sunni cleric Abdel Wahed and his bodyguard, Mohammad Hussein Merheb, when his convoy failed to stop at a checkpoint in North Lebanon, the scene of deadly clashes linked to the uprising in Syria-NOW Lebanon
